results.title: Tristan und Isolde
results.brief_description: A magnificent production by the Bayreuther Festspiele, under the direction of Daniel Barenboim and Jean-Pierre Ponnelle. Tristan, sung by Rene Kollo, and Isolde by Johanna Meier tells the tale of two fated lovers who are caught up in a web of intrigue. Ultimately the fulfillment of their love comes through death and transfiguration.

results.title: Triple word score [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Armagan Ballantyne, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Sisters Phyllis and Hazel prefer to communicate via the Scrabble board. When a stranger joins their midst, albeit briefly, they are forced to question their circumstances, and the nature of their relationship. Cast includes Iris Shand, Dorothy Cox and Ben Gabriel.

results.title: Tripe. Sharkey's party
results.creator_credit: Greg Woodland, Peter Lawless and Lawless Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tripe (1985): Gothic spoof in which four grown children read cookbooks for pleasure having been fed a steady diet of tripe by their domineering father and Victorian aunt Esme - until things get even blacker. Cast includes John Meillon, Gary Waddell, Sally McKenzie, Cate Brennan, Tim Ailwood and Steve Houston. “Sharkey’s Party” (1986): A less angst counterpoint to “Dogs in Space”. Having just come out of a mental institiution Sharkey’s friends throw him a party. Musicians, jaded punks, out-of-date hippies, sharehouses, drugs and life on the dole make up this portrayal of Australian youth culture in the 1980’s. Cast includes David Argue and Sally McKenzie.

results.title: Trio: exploring threads and textiles
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A film for classroom teachers. Presents three different teachers in three different schools who have their own special way of incorporating Threads and Textiles into their program of Art Education. These teachers do not represent a random sample of teachers involved in using the course, but were simply selected because they were eager to introduce Threads and Textiles in to the classroom.

results.title: Trinity House
results.brief_description: On Tower Hill stands the fire-scarred shell of Trinity House; but although this building was damaged during World War 2, the work of the organisation it housed goes on regardless of war or bombs. Trinity House is responsible for the administration and maintenance of Britain’s 1217 lighthouses, 87 lightships, and countless buoys, pilot boats, markers, and other aids to navigation. Trinity House pilots steer ships through shoals and past hidden reefs and rocks in British waters.

results.title: Triggers series. No. 1
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Illustrates six different classroom situations. Trigger 1 raises the issue of the lecturer’s responsibility in stimulating the students’ interest, in addition to presenting information; Trigger 2 considers the function of lectures in the teaching-learning process, focusing on a communication model; Trigger 3 emphasises the fact that teaching may not result in learning, by focusing on teaching techniques; Trigger 4 demonstrates that there may be a gap between verbal and non-verbal communication; Trigger 5 raises the question of relevance, and the differing perceptions of students and staff; Trigger 6 portrays an incident which often provides a basis for teacher-student conflict. Designed to encourage discussion about teaching and learning situations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre

results.title: Trial run
results.creator_credit: Melanie Read, Don Reynolds, CTM Cinema and Television and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: When she is offered an assignment photographing rare penguins, Rosemary, a middle-distance runner, leaves her family for six months to live in a cottage on the coast. Her son, also a keen runner, devises a training schedule for her on his computer and, along with his sister, visits her frequently for running sessions. Despite regular contact with family and friends, Rosemary is disturbed by unexplained attacks on her house, strange noises in the night, and intimidation from her misogynist neighbour and his dog. Even when the attacks escalate she insists on staying in the cottage until one night, alone and terrified, she is forced to run for her life. This feminist approach to the psychological thriller portrays its female protagonists as strong, independent and quite capable of looking after themselves while effectively utilising lighting, music and shooting styles usually associated with this genre to build suspense and tension.

results.title: Trial at Nuremberg. Facing judgement.
results.brief_description: This video documents the trial of 21 German war criminals at Nuremberg over a period of 217 days from November 1945-1946. This film describes the events at the end of the Second World war leading up to the trials. “Facing judgement” is a Movietone newsreel following the trial of Adolph Eichmann in Israel in 1961 for crimes committed during the Second World War.

results.title: Trevor Island
results.brief_description:
The latest adventure from Australia’s ATOM award winning supercat. Trevor’s family move to a tropical island and decide to set up an airport and car park. A sedate lifestyle, however, is not Trevor’s trademark. As usual, Trevor meets this challenge in his own way.
Voices by Richard Healy, Jane Lewis, Danny Nash, David Crosbie and John Taylor.
